page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: Upham is a small village set among the chalk downlands of Hampshire. This area is very rural, being mostly woods and farmlands, with few houses. In fact the Tithe Map of 1838 looks very much the same as Upham does now in 1985. The present main road was new in those days, but most of the cottages and farms which are along it now were just the same then. The land has been farmed since Roman times and there are in fact the remains of a Roman Road and villa in the district. Some of the families living here have been in the area for generations, but there is also a strong contingent of people who live in the village and work in nearby towns and cities. The population at present numbers 247.
